chunk: Sweet potato fingers recipe Delicious baked sweet potato, sliced into easy-to-eat sticks for your baby. Age: 6 months or older Prep: 5 mins Cook: 25 mins Portions: 3 (approx) Ingredients - 1 small sweet potato, peeled - 1 tbsp vegetable oil Method Preheat the oven to 200C. Slice the sweet potato into finger-sized wedges – big enough for your baby to hold in their hand with the top half poking out. Rub the sweet potato wedges with the oil, then place on a baking tray. Bake in the oven for 20 to 30 minutes – cook until the sweet potato is soft and starting to brown a little. Allow to cool, remove any excess oil with kitchen paper before serving. Information: Serve with full-fat plain yoghurt for dipping. Weaning tip Finger foods help babies get used to different textures and also help develop hand-eye coordination.
title: Sweet Potato Fingers
description: Delicious baked sweet potato, sliced into easy-to-eat sticks for your baby.
